## Building Safety Regulator (BSR) Expertise

::: {style="margin: 48px 0; padding: 40px; background: linear-gradient(135deg, #f8f9fa 0%, #e9ecef 100%); border-radius: 8px; border-left: 6px solid var(--bim-orange);"}

### Navigating the New Building Safety Regime

The Building Safety Act 2022 introduced the **Building Safety Regulator (BSR)** under the Health and Safety Executive (HSE), fundamentally changing how Higher Risk Buildings (HRB) are designed, constructed, and maintained. We provide specialized cost estimation services aligned with BSR requirements.

::: {style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(300px, 1fr)); gap: 24px; margin: 32px 0;"}

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: white; border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 2px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);"}
#### Higher Risk Buildings (HRB) Definition
**Buildings Requiring BSR Registration:**
- 18 metres or more in height, OR
- 7 storeys or more, AND
- Contains at least 2 residential units

**Our Cost Support:**
- Registration compliance costs
- Mandatory occurrence reporting systems
- Resident engagement requirements
- Safety case preparation budgets
:::

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: white; border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 2px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);"}
#### Gateway Process Costing
**Gateway 2 (Planning Stage):**
- Fire statement preparation
- Building Safety Act compliance review
- BSR submission documentation

**Gateway 3 (Pre-Construction):**
- Detailed design compliance
- Fire and structural strategies
- Change control procedures
- Principal Designer costs
:::

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: white; border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 2px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);"}
#### Building Safety Case Support
**Safety Case Development Costs:**
- Risk assessments & evaluations
- Building management structure
- Safety management systems
- Documentation & compliance records
- Ongoing monitoring requirements
- Mandatory occurrence reporting
:::

:::

## Common Remediation Project Types

::: {style="margin: 48px 0;"}
### Understanding Remediation Complexity

::: {style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(300px, 1fr)); gap: 24px; margin: 32px 0;"}

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Cladding Remediation
**Building Height:** Typically 18m+  
**Complexity:** High  
**Timeline:** 5-8 days  
**Typical Cost:** £3,000-8,000 per unit

**Scope Includes:**
- ACM/HPL cladding removal
- Compliant system installation
- Fire barriers & cavity barriers
- External wall insulation (if required)
- Balcony works & fire stopping
- Scaffolding & protection
- Building survey & testing
:::

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Fire Safety Upgrades
**Building Type:** Multi-occupancy  
**Complexity:** Medium-High  
**Timeline:** 4-6 days  
**Typical Cost:** £1,500-4,000 per unit

**Scope Includes:**
- Compartmentation upgrades
- Fire door replacements
- Smoke ventilation (AOV)
- Fire alarm systems
- Emergency lighting
- Sprinkler systems (if required)
- Wayfinding & signage
:::

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Structural Repairs
**Building Age:** Variable  
**Complexity:** High  
**Timeline:** 5-7 days  
**Typical Cost:** £2,000-6,000 per unit

**Scope Includes:**
- Concrete repairs (spalling)
- Structural strengthening
- Balcony reconstruction
- Movement joint repairs
- Waterproofing systems
- Underpinning (if required)
- Temporary propping
:::

:::
:::

## Our Remediation Estimation Process

::: {.process-steps}
::: {.process-step}
#### Initial Assessment & Data Review

**Day 1 (4-6 hours)**

**What We Do:**
- Review building survey reports
- Examine intrusive investigation data
- Study fire risk assessments (FRA)
- Review EWS1 forms & recommendations
- Identify compliance requirements

**Client Provides:**
- Building survey reports
- Fire risk assessments
- Structural reports (if available)
- Existing drawings/as-builts
- BSR/planning conditions

**Output:** Project scope confirmation
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Scope Definition & Quantification

**Days 1-3**

**What We Do:**
- Define remediation scope
- Quantify cladding areas
- Calculate fire barrier requirements
- Assess structural repair extent
- Identify interface works
- Map resident impact zones

**Technology:**
- BIM 5D extraction (if BIM available)
- 2D takeoff from surveys
- Building elevation analysis

**Output:** Complete quantity take-off (BOQ)
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Cost Application & Risk Analysis

**Days 3-5**

**What We Do:**
- Apply current remediation rates
- Factor in access difficulties
- Calculate phasing costs
- Assess contamination risks
- Include occupied building premiums
- Apply risk-based contingencies (15-25%)

**Database Sources:**
- BCIS remediation data
- Live specialist quotes
- Recent cladding projects

**Output:** Detailed cost estimate with risk register
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Quality Review & Reporting

**Days 5-7**

**What We Do:**
- Technical peer review
- Check against benchmarks
- Verify compliance scope
- Prepare funding documentation
- Create leaseholder summary
- Schedule presentation

**Deliverables:**
- Executive summary (2-3 pages)
- Cost breakdown by work package
- BOQ with quantities and rates
- Funding application pack
- Risk register & contingencies

**Format:** PDF + Excel workbooks
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Presentation & Consultation Support

**Day 7-8**

**What We Do:**
- Present findings to stakeholders
- Explain cost drivers and risks
- Review phasing options
- Discuss resident communication
- Support leaseholder consultation
- Provide ongoing advice

**Meeting Options:**
- In-person (UK only)
- Video conference (all locations)
- Leaseholder presentations

**Support:** 30 days post-delivery included
:::
:::

::: {style="text-align: center; margin: 32px 0; padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-radius: 8px;"}
**Typical Total Duration:** 5-8 working days from survey data receipt to final report  
**Express Service:** Available for urgent BSR deadlines (3-4 days) at 25% premium
:::

## Frequently Asked Questions

::: {.faq-section}
::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Can you estimate remediation costs without intrusive surveys?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: We can provide indicative budgets based on visual surveys and typical defect patterns, but we strongly recommend intrusive investigation before finalizing estimates. We typically include 20-25% contingency for non-intrusive estimates vs 10-15% for fully surveyed buildings.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: How do you handle unknown defects discovered during works?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Our estimates include risk-based contingencies (typically 15-25%) calculated from intrusive survey findings and industry benchmarks. We also provide a risk register identifying potential additional costs with probability assessments.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Can you support Building Safety Fund (BSF) applications?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Yes, we regularly prepare cost documentation for BSF and other grant applications. We provide the detailed breakdown formats required by funding bodies and can support the technical review process.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: What about phasing to keep residents in occupation?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: We specialize in occupied building remediation. Our estimates include phasing strategies, protection costs, temporary works, resident liaison, and the cost premium for working around occupants (typically 15-20% additional).
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: How accurate are remediation estimates given the unknowns?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: With proper intrusive surveys, we achieve ±5-8% accuracy on remediation projects (vs our standard ±5% for new build). The additional variance accounts for unexpected defects. We provide clear contingency breakdowns for transparency.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Can you estimate alternative cladding systems for comparison?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Absolutely. We regularly compare different compliant cladding systems (brick slip, render, metal panels, terracotta) with full cost implications including performance characteristics, maintenance, and longevity considerations.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: What about asbestos or other hazardous materials?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: We include allowances for asbestos surveys and removal when building age suggests likely presence. We work with specialist asbestos surveyors to refine removal costs and include proper disposal, air monitoring, and notification costs.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: What's your fee structure for remediation projects?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Fees vary based on building size, defect complexity, and urgency. As a rough guide:
- Small building (20-50 units): £3,500-6,000
- Medium building (50-100 units): £6,000-10,000
- Large building (100-200 units): £10,000-16,000
